title: Charge density - net charge from given field

content.question: Which expression is equal to the net charge of the sphere?

choices.label: <math alttext="pi script lowercase E sub 0, end subscript, times b uppercase R cubed" overflow="scroll"><mi>π</mi><msub><mi>ε</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>b</mi><msup><mi>R</mi><mn>3</mn></msup></math>

<math alttext="4 pi script lowercase E sub 0, end subscript, times b uppercase R cubed" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mi>π</mi><msub><mi>ε</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>b</mi><msup><mi>R</mi><mn>3</mn></msup></math>
<math alttext="pi b uppercase R to the 4 power" overflow="scroll"><mi>π</mi><mi>b</mi><msup><mi>R</mi><mn>4</mn></msup></math>
<math alttext="4 pi b uppercase R to the 4 power" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mi>π</mi><mi>b</mi><msup><mi>R</mi><mn>4</mn></msup></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="4 pi script lowercase E sub 0, end subscript, times b uppercase R cubed" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mi>π</mi><msub><mi>ε</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>b</mi><msup><mi>R</mi><mn>3</mn></msup></math>

unit.text: 8: Electric Charges, Fields, and Gauss's Law

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
